aspects.current_activity: Patrolling a rocky section of the mountain path, occasionally stopping to sniff the air and listen for any unusual sounds.
aspects.short_term_goal: Ensure that no trespassers disturb the wildlife or the natural order of the mountain.
aspects.long_term_goal: To gain the trust of the mountain spirits, hoping to be recognized as an eternal guardian of these grounds.
aspects.personality: Intensely loyal and protective, but with a gentle demeanor towards those who show respect to the mountain.
aspects.fear_weakness: Fear of abandoned or forgotten places; he feels diminished in places devoid of life and energy.
aspects.belief_value: Believes in the balance of nature and the importance of protecting the mountain from those who would exploit it.
aspects.relationship: Has a bond with a reclusive ranger who shares tales of the mountain's glories, serving as a mentor in understanding the land.
aspects.potential_quest: He asks the player to retrieve a lost charm belonging to the ranger, which enhances his connection to the mountain spirits.

dialogue: Greetings, traveler. Be careful on these treacherous paths; many stumble here without a guide.
The winds tell me of an unease nearby. Have you heard anything unusual during your journey?
I sense a visitor’s presence—what brings you to this lonely corner of the world?
Beware of those who take without giving back; the mountain doesn’t forget wrongdoings.
I can help you find your way, but be honest with me—your intentions matter more than you know.
Safe travels, friend. May the spirits of the mountain watch over your steps.

stats.name: Brakkun
stats.title: Guardian of the Mountain Path
stats.languages: Understands Common and Sylvan, but can only bark and growl.

actions.name: Bite
actions.description: Brakkun bites at an enemy with a powerful jaws, dealing 1d6 + 3 piercing damage on a hit.

actions.name: Protective Growl
actions.description: Brakkun emits a low, rumbling growl, imposing disadvantage on attack rolls made against him until the start of his next turn.

loot: Brakkun carries an old, weather-worn collar with inscriptions marking his loyalty to the mountain and the ranger, as well as a small pouch containing a few healing herbs he collects during his patrols.

description.summary: A rugged mountain dog with keen senses and a loyal heart, serving as a guardian of the mountain path.
details: His fur is a thick, matted coat of dark browns and blacks, dusted with frost from the chilly mountain air, hinting at both endurance and rugged beauty.
The sharp glint in his amber eyes reflects the early morning sun, and he emits a low, reassuring growl that resonates through the crisp silence of the mountain trail.
As he moves, his powerful legs seem to glide effortlessly over the rocky ground, the soft padding of his paws barely making a sound despite his size.
The scent of pine and distant campfires mingles with the earthy musk of the dog, creating a comforting yet wild atmosphere that evokes the spirit of the mountains.
When he sits, his large, bushy tail thumps against the ground like a gentle drumbeat, revealing his alert nature and readiness to defend his territory against any intruder.
